intro: Trisetella huebneri, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open plains. Trisetella huebneri is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
